intro: Neocabreria concinna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neocabreria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic uses. Neocabreria concinna is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
